conclusion: Use the formula F = I * L * B * sin(theta) to find the force on a current-carrying conductor in a magnetic field.
The wire is folded into a right-angle with segments ac = L and cd = 2L in a uniform magnetic field.
Identify the effective length of the wire as consisting of segments ac and cd.
Calculate force on segment ac: F_ac = I * L * B * sin(90°) = I * L * B.
Calculate force on segment cd: F_cd = I * 2L * B * sin(90°) = I * 2L * B.
Calculate total force as the vector sum: F_total = F_ac + F_cd = I * B * (L + 2L) = I * B * 3L.
The magnitude of the Ampere force is F_total = 3IBL.
